New Records: India recorded a 100-run victory over England, maintaining their unbeaten start in the World Cup
Key Match Events: England were bowled out for 129 in 34.5 overs with Livingstone top-scoring with 27; Shami took 4-22 and Bumrah 3-32; India made 229-9 with Rohit hitting 87; Willey took 3-45 including Kohli for a duck and Suryakumar for 49
Pre-Game Insights: England were expected to perform better given their home advantage but struggled; India's batting depth and experience were key factors
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed disappointment with England's performance; Rohit Sharma highlighted the team's character and experience; Matthew Mott suggested changes in leadership with Eoin Morgan taking over
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's poor batting form and lack of consistency led to their fifth consecutive loss; the match marked a challenging phase for the English team ahead of the World Cup
Others: The article provided detailed analysis of the match, including live updates, expert commentary, and fan reactions
